intro: Hieracium eulepodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium eulepodes is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
